evolution_stages.conversation_summary: 1) Problems discussed: Gregory's fear of networking events, difficulty starting and maintaining conversations with professionals, and anxiety about sounding scripted or unprepared. 2) Solutions offered/accepted: Breaking down networking into manageable steps, using low-pressure questions, practicing specific responses, and reframing conversations as collaborations. 3) Student's response to solutions: Gregory engaged in role-playing, accepted the suggested questions, and showed willingness to practice further. 4) Evidence of progress/improvement: Gregory demonstrated improved conversation skills during practice, developed follow-up questions, and showed a positive mindset shift towards viewing networking as collaborative rather than performative.

Solutions offered/accepted: Breaking down networking into manageable steps, using low-pressure questions, practicing specific responses, and reframing conversations as collaborations. evolution_stages.conversation_summary: 1) Problems discussed: Gregory's fear of networking events and starting conversations with professors, his challenge in overcoming procrastination and navigating campus politics, and his anxiety about sounding stupid or boring. 2) Solutions offered/accepted: The AI Coach suggested breaking down networking into manageable steps, using low-pressure questions, and practicing one-on-one conversations. Gregory accepted these solutions and engaged in role-playing. 3) Student's response to solutions: Gregory showed willingness to practice and acknowledged the effectiveness of the strategies, such as using open-ended questions and embracing awkwardness. 4) Evidence of progress/improvement: Gregory practiced specific questions and responses, engaged in role-playing, and shifted his mindset to view conversations as collaboration rather than performance.
